Cybersecurity is a risk management issue, not solely a technology problem. The cybersecurity strategy of the United States Government is built on a core goal executed along five lines of effort. It is articulated publicly so that all stakeholders, from the citizens it supports to those with the obligation to implement it, have a complete understanding of our strategy and vision for the future.

Goal: Promote an open and transparent government that protects the People’s information while preserving privacy, civil rights, and civil liberties.

Five Lines of Effort:

  • Harden the workforce
  • Treat Information as an Asset
  • Do the Right Things the Right Way
  • Continuously Innovate and Invest Wisely
  • Make Informed Cyber Risk Decisions at the Right Level

The United States Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), Brigadier General (retired) Greg Touhill leads the effort to secure the People’s information technology (IT) systems in support of the president.
